ranked_diseases.explanation: Fragile X Syndrome is the most common inherited cause of intellectual disability and often includes features such as delayed speech and language development and ADHD.
Characterized by intellectual disability and delayed speech and language development. Hyperactivity is also commonly associated, making it relevant.
This syndrome includes intellectual disability, speech delays, and hyperactivity, aligning well with the present symptoms.
Untreated phenylketonuria can result in intellectual disability and behavioral issues such as ADHD, although less commonly associated with speech delays.
Mostly affecting females, Rett Syndrome presents with intellectual disability and delayed speech, but typically more severe neurological symptoms. Considered due to overlapping features.
